intro: Topobea longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed topobea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
